Zippy little utilities for your frameworks.   All the parts you don't want to write for   Next  and   Nuxt .      +200+ functions  Typescript support  Under 10kb (gzipped)  Modifiers, utilities, validators and sanitizers      What's included      Nuxt Architecture   Harness the full power of   Nuxt 3  and its   modules  ecosystem.    Nuxt Studio ready   Edit your theme content and appearance with live-preview within   Nuxt Studio .    Vue Components   Use built-in components (or your own!) inside your content.    Write Markdown   Enjoy the ease and simplicity of Markdown and discover   MDC syntax .    Deploy anywhere   Zero config on   Vercel  or   Netlify . Choose between static generation, on-demand rendering (Node) or edge-side rendering on   CloudFlare workers .    Extensible.   Customize the whole design, or add components using slots - you can make Docus your own.
From your Markdown files to a deployed website in few minutes.

Getting Started  From your Markdown files to a deployed website in few minutes.  Play online  You can start playing with Docus in your browser using Stackblitz:  Play on StackBlitz  Create a new project   Start a fresh Docus project with:     npx   nuxi@latest   init   docs   -t   themes/docus
   Install the dependencies in the   docs  folder:      npm   install
     yarn   install
     pnpm   install   --shamefully-hoist
   Run the   dev  command to start Docus in development mode:      npm   run   dev
     yarn   dev
     pnpm   run   dev
   âœ¨ Well done! Modifiers are a key feature of Mods that allow you to easily modify and enhance your content. They are small pieces of code that can be applied to your JS to add functionality, validation or style.

What are modifiers?  Modifiers are a key feature of Mods that allow you to easily modify and enhance your content. They are small pieces of code that can be applied to your JS to add functionality, validation or style.
Docus is made to let you write all your content in Markdown and Vue components with the MDC syntax.

Writing Pages  Docus is made to let you write all your content in Markdown and Vue components with the MDC syntax.  Each Markdown pages in the   content/  folder will be mapped to a route. 





























     File  Generated route     index.md   /    about.md   /about    blog/index.md   /blog    blog/hello.md   /blog/hello    1.guide/2.installation   /guide/installation  Frontmatter  Docus supports multiple Front-matter attributes for pages.     ---
   title  :   "Get Started"
   description  :   "Let's learn how to use my amazing module."
   ---
 































































































      Key   Type   Default   Description     layout   string   default  Use any layout name like you would in   definePageMeta()    title   string   Defines the page title and H1 in docs pages    description   string   Defines the page description and excerpt in docs pages    redirect   string   A route path to redirect    image   object   OpenGraph cover image    Docs layout options       aside   boolean   Toggles the visibility of aside navigation    toc   boolean   Toggles the visibility of table of contents    header   boolean   Toggles the visibility of the page header    bottom   boolean   Toggles the visibility of page bottom section    Navigation options       navigation   boolean   Toggles the visibility of the page or directory in navigation    navigation.title   string   Changes the name of the page or directory in navigation    navigation.icon   string   Changes the icon of the page or directory in navigation  html .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html.dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}html .dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}html .default .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}
Actions  A collection of useful actions  // subtitle: Page Actions  // description: A collection of useful actions  // subtitle: Form Actions  // description: A collection of useful actions

Detections  A collection of detections for common data types  detectDevice  Detect the current device type (Mobile or Desktop)     detectDevice  ()
     `Mobile` or `Desktop`
  detectDeviceType  Detect the device OS (iOS, Android, Windows, etc.)     detectDeviceType  ()
     `iOS`, `Android`, `Windows`, `Mac`, `Linux`, `UNIX`, or `Unknown`
  detectBrowser  Detects the user's browser based on the user agent string.     detectBrowser  ()
     A string representing the detected browser.
  detectActiveBrowser  Detect if the browser window is currently active or hidden.     detectActiveBrowser  ()
  detectColorScheme  Detect the current color scheme     detectColorScheme  ()
  detectOS  Detect the current operating system     `getOS()`
  detectBrowserLanguage  Detect the current browser language     detectBrowserLanguage  ()
  detectGeolocation  Detect the current user's location     detectUserLocation  ()
  detectDeviceOrientation  Detect the currect device orientation     detectDeviceOrientation  ()
  detectDeviceMotion  Detect the current device motion     detectDeviceMotion  ()
  detectTailwindContainerBreakpoint  Detect the current container breakpoint based on Tailwind CSS breakpoints     detectTailwindContainerBreakpoint  (  'container'  )
  detectScrollPosition  Detect the current scroll position of the window     detectScrollPosition  ()

Formatters  A collection of formatters for common data types  formatCurrency  Format numbers into local currency     formatCurrency  (  1234.56  )
     $1,234.56
  formatCurrencyUnits  Format a number as a currency in thousands, millions, or billions     formatCurrencyUnits  (  1234567890  )
     $1.23B
  formatTime  Format time into hours, minutes, and seconds     formatTime  (  3723  )
     1hr 2min 3s
  formatDatetime  Format Unix timestamp into a datetime string     formatDatetime  (  1619097600  )
     2021-04-22 00:00:00
  formatPercentage  Format a number into a percentage     formatPercentage  (  0.1234  )
     12.34%
  formatList  Create a string of comma-separated values from an array of strings with an optional conjunction.     commaList  ([  'one'  ,   'two'  ,   'three'  ])
     one, two and three

Generators  A collection of generators  generateShortId  Generate a unique short ID based on the current timestamp     generateShortId  (  36  )
     1HR2MIN3S
  generateInitials  Generate initials from any string     generateInitials  (  'John Doe'  )
     JD

Modifiers Modifiers are a key feature of Mods that allow you to easily modify and enhance your content. They are small pieces of code that can be applied to your JS to add functionality, validation or style. widont Adds a space between the last two words in a string. widont ( 'Cool cool cool' ) cool cool   cool stripHtml Strip HTML tags from a string. stripHtml ( '

Hello World

' ) Hello World escapeHtml Escape HTML entities in a string. escapeHtml ( '

Hello World

' ) < p > Hello World < /p > unescapeHtml Unescape HTML entities in a string. unescapeHtml ( '<p>Hello World</p>' ) < p >Hello World stripTags Strip HTML tags from a string. stripTags ( '

Hello World

' ) Hello World slugify Converts a string to-a-slug. slugify ( 'Hello World' ) hello-world deslugify Converts a slug to a string. deslugify ( 'hello-world' ) hello world truncate Truncates a string to a specified length of characters. truncate ( 'Hello World' , 5 ) Hello... truncateWords Truncates a string by a number of words truncateWords ( 'Hello World' , 1 ) Hello... countWords Counts the number of words in a string. countWords ( 'Hello World' ) 2 countCharacters Counts the number of characters in a string. countCharacters ( 'Hello World' ) 11 countLines Counts the number of lines in a string. countLines ( 'Hello World' ) 1 stripWhitespace Strips whitespace from a string. stripWhitespace ( 'Hello World' ) HelloWorld stripNumbers Strips numbers from a string. stripNumbers ( 'Hello World 123' ) Hello World stripPunctuation Strips punctuation from a string. stripPunctuation ( 'Hello World!' ) Hello World stripSymbols Strips symbols from a string. stripSymbols ( 'Hello World!' ) Hello World stripEmojis Strips emojis from a string (requires ES6 Unicode support) ðŸ¦Š. stripEmojis ( 'Hello World! ðŸ¦Š' ) Hello World! readingTime Returns the reading time of a string in Hours, Minutes, and Seconds. readingTime ( 'Once, in a vibrant online forum, lived Mod Max, guardian of digital harmony. Max cherished his old scooter, Swift, a symbol of freedom. Navigating both virtual and real worlds, they became legends. Trolls quivered, posts flourished, and lanes whizzed by. Swiftâ€™s wheels spun tales, and Maxâ€™s keys kept peace. Together, they discovered uncharted threads and hidden lanes. Their journey, an endless adventure, painted pixels and pavements with stories of unity and exhilaration, leaving a trail for all in the intertwined realms of screens and streets.' ) 1 minute pluralize Adds plurals to a string. pluralize ( 'scooter' , 10 ) scooters singularize Removes plurals from a string. singularize ( 'scooters' ) scooter ordinalize Converts a number to a string with ordinal suffix. ordinalize ( 1 ) 1st humanize Replaces underscores with spaces and capitalizes the first letter of each word. humanize ( 'hello_world' ) Hello World camelCase Removes spaces and capitalizes the first letter of each word except for the first word. camelCase ( 'hello world' ) helloWorld pascalCase Removes spaces and capitalizes the first letter of each word. pascalCase ( 'hello world' ) HelloWorld snakeCase Replaces spaces with underscores and converts to lowercase. snakeCase ( 'hello world' ) hello_world kebabCase Replaces spaces with hyphens and converts to lowercase. titleize ( 'Hello World' ) hello-world titleCase Converts to title case by capitalizing the first letter of each word. titleCase ( 'hello world' ) Hello World sentenceCase Converts to sentence case by capitalizing the first letter of the first word. sentenceCase ( 'hello world' ) Hello world startWith Adds a prefix to a string if it doesn't already start with the prefix. startWith ( 'usemods.com' , 'https://' ) https://usemods.com startWithout Removes a prefix from a string if it starts with the prefix. startWithout ( 'https://usemods.com' , 'https://' ) usemods.com endWith Adds a suffix to a string if it doesn't already end with the suffix. endWith ( 'https://usemods' , '.com' ) https://usemods.com endWithout Removes a suffix from a string if it ends with the suffix. endWithout ( 'https://usemods.com.au' , '.au' ) https://usemods.com surround Adds a prefix and suffix to a string if it doesn't already start and end with them. surround ( 'https://' , 'usemods' , '.com' ) https://usemods.com title Converts a string to title case following the Chicago Manual of Style rules. title ( 'the quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog' ) The Quick Brown Fox Jumps over the Lazy Dog splitByWords Wraps each word in a string with a span tag. splitByWords ( 'Hello World. How are you?' ) < span class = "sentence sentence-1" >< span class = "word word-1" >Hello < span class = "word word-2" >world. < span class = "sentence sentence-2" >< span class = "word word-3" >How < span class = "word word-4" >are < span class = "word word-5" >you? list Creates an array of list items (
  • ) from an array of strings. list ([ 'one' , 'two' , 'three' ]) < ul >< li >one< li >two< li >three shuffle Shuffles an array. shuffle ([ 'one' , 'two' , 'three' ]) ['three', 'one', 'two'] last Returns the last item in an array. last ([ 'one' , 'two' , 'three' ]) three nth Returns the nth item in an array. nth ([ 'one' , 'two' , 'three' ], 1 ) two html .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html.dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}html .dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}html .default .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}

This file contains functions that are related to numbers.  random  Generates a random integer between the specified minimum and maximum values.     random  (  1  ,   10  )
     5
  sum  Calculates the sum of an array of numbers.     sum  ([  1  ,   2  ,   3  ])
     6
  mean  Calculates the mean of an array of numbers.     average  ([  1  ,   2  ,   3  ])
     2
  average  Calculates the mean of an array of numbers.     average  ([  1  ,   2  ,   3  ])
     2
  median  Calculates the median of an array of numbers.     median  ([  1  ,   2  ,   3  ])
     2
  mode  Calculates the mode of an array of numbers.     mode  ([  1  ,   2  ,   2  ,   3  ])
     2
  max  Finds the maximum value in an array of numbers.     max  ([  1  ,   2  ,   3  ])
     3
  clamp  Clamps a number between the specified minimum and maximum values.     clamp  (  1  ,   10  ,   20  )
     10
  range  Returns the range of an array of numbers.     range  ([  1  ,   2  ,   3  ])
     2
  minMax  Returns the minimum and maximum values in an array of numbers.     minMax  ([  1  ,   2  ,   3  ,   4  ,   5  ])
     [1, 5]
  rangeAsPercentage  Returns the difference between two values, as a percentage.     differenceAsPercentage  (  10  ,   20  )
     100
  percentage  Returns the percentage of a value, relative to another value.     percentage  (  10  ,   100  )
     10
  standardDeviation  Returns the standard deviation of an array of numbers.     standardDeviation  ([  1  ,   2  ,   3  ,   20  ,   120  ,   2000  ])
     0.5
  skewness  Returns the measure of asymmetry of the probability distribution of an array of numbers. The skewness value can be positive, zero, negative, or undefined.     skewness  ([  1  ,   2  ,   3  ,   20  ,   120  ,   2000  ])
     2.5

Validators  A collection of validators for common data types  isEmail  Check if the input is a valid email address.     isEmail  (  'hello@usemods.com'  )
     true
  isNumber  Check if the input is a valid number.     isNumber  (  '123'  )
     true
  isURL  Check if the input is a valid URL.     isURL  (  'https://usemods.com'  )
     true
  isUUID  Check if the input is a valid UUID.     isUUID  (  'c9bf9e57-1685-4c89-bafb-ff5af830be8a'  )
     true
  isJSON  Check if the input is a valid JSON string.     isJSON  (  '{"hello": "world"}'  )
     true
  isHex  Check if the input is a valid hexadecimal color code.     isHex  (  '#fff'  )
     true
  isEmpty  Check if the input is an empty string.     isEmpty  (  ''  )
     true
  isAlpha  Check if the input contains only alphabetic characters.     isAlpha  (  'hello'  )
     true
  isAlphanumeric  Check if the input contains only alphanumeric characters.     isAlphanumeric  (  'hello123'  )
     true
  isArray  Check if the input is an array.     isArray  ([  1  ,   2  ,   3  ])
     true
  isObject  Check if the input is an object.     isObject  ({ hello:   'world'   })
     true
  isBoolean  Check if the input is a boolean value.     isBoolean  (  true  )
     true
  isFunction  Check if the input is a function.     isFunction  (()   =>   {})
     true
  isUndefined  Check if the input is undefined.     isUndefined  (  undefined  )
     true
  isNull  Check if the input is null.     isNull  (  null  )
     true
  isDate  Check if the input is a valid Date object.     isDate  (  new   Date  ())
     true
  isError  Check if the input is an Error object with a defined message.     isError  (  new   Error  (  'hello'  ))
     true
  isTime  Check if the input is a valid time in HH:mm format.     isTime  (  '12:00'  )
     true
  isLeapYear  Check if the input year is a leap year.     isLeapYear  (  2020  )
     true
  isPromise  Check if the input is a Promise object.     isPromise  (  new   Promise  (()   =>   {}))
     true
  isSet  Check if the input is a Set object.     isSet  (  new   Set  ())
     true
  isMap  Check if the input is a Map object.     isMap  (  new   Map  ())
     true
  isEven  Check if the number is even.     isEven  (  2  )
     true
  isOdd  Check if the number is odd.     isOdd  (  3  )
     true
  isPositive  Check if the number is positive.     isPositive  (  1  )
     true
  isNegative  Check if the number is negative.     isNegative  (  -  1  )
     true
  isZero  Check if the number is zero.     isZero  (  0  )
     true
  isPrime  Check if the number is a prime number.     isPrime  (  7  )
     true
  isOptimusPrime  Check if the string is equal to "Optimus Prime".     isOptimusPrime  (  'Optimus Prime'  )
     true
  isPalindrome  Check if the string is a palindrome.     isPalindrome  (  'racecar'  )
     true
  isInteger  Check if the number is an integer.     isInteger  (  1  )
     true
  isFloat  Check if the number is a float.     isFloat  (  1.5  )
     true
  isBetween  Check if the number is between the specified range.     isBetween  (  5  ,   1  ,   10  )
     true
  isDivisibleBy  Check if the number is divisible by the specified number.     isDivisibleBy  (  10  ,   2  )
     true
  isCreditCardNumber  Check if the input is a valid credit card number.     isCreditCardNumber  (  '4242424242424242'  )
     true
  isIPAddress  Check if the input is a valid IP address.     isIPAddress  (  '127.0.0.0'  )
     true
  isMACAddress  Check if the input is a valid MAC address.     isMACAddress  (  '00:00:00:00:00:00'  )
     true
  isLatLng  Check if the input is a valid latitude-longitude coordinate in the format lat,lng or lat,lng.     isLatLng  (  '40.741895,-73.989308'  )
     true
  isLatitude  Check if the input is a valid latitude coordinate.     isLatitude  (  '40.741895'  )
     true
  isLongitude  Check if the input is a valid longitude coordinate.     isLongitude  (  '-73.989308'  )
     true
  isPort  Check if the input is a valid port number.     isPort  (  3000  )
     true
  isPresent  Checks if a property and value pair exists in an object.     hasPropertyValue  ({ hello:   'world'   },   'hello'  ,   'world'  )
     true
  hasProperties  Check if a property exists in an object without checking its value.     hasProperties  ({ hello:   'world'   }, [  'hello'  ,   'world'  ])
     true
  hasKeys  Check if an array of key exists in an object     hasKeys  ({ hello:   'world'   }, [  'hello'  ,   'world'  ,])
     true
